groovin' dizzy gillespie alyn shipton illustrated 422 pp oxford apprenticeship bands teddy cab calloway 1930 trumpeter birks dizzy gillespie gained reputation enfant terrible jazz reputation quick temper penchant advanced chord offbeat rhythms gillespie beloved musicians alike jazz handful alto saxophonist charlie parker pianist bud powell drummer kenny clarke gillespie spearheaded revolution 1940 revolutions guessed bebop ultimately jazz selfconsciously avantgarde quo 1955 parker 1959 coltrane popularized modal improvisation album ornette coleman shocked clubgoers aharmonic brand freeform jazz gillespie peak instrumentalist improviser surviving pioneers bebop surprising groovin' biography gillespie thorough summary exception bop gillespie valuable poorly organized fanciful 1979 autobiography fraser jazz critic alyn shipton plausibly argues gradual transformation gillespie accelerated pace jazz evolution mellowing shipton draws irony implicit gillespie persona bebop broke tradition primarily listening dancing gillespie scat singing flamboyant clowning band 1940 visionary outfit retained elements gillespie encountered sideman cab calloway furthermore bebop purest lasted
